Situation1: Include each other in social activities and outings when possible.
Expectation2: Communicate politely and professionally with customers
Situation2: The customer asks about the delivery status
Story: I was just about to leave for my sister’s birthday dinner when my phone buzzed. She’d been looking forward to this night for weeks, and I promised I’d be there early to help set up. As I grabbed my keys, another notification popped up—an urgent message from a customer. They wanted an update on their package, and my company expected quick, polite responses at all times. I could already hear my sister’s voice in my head, reminding me how much it meant to her that I included her in my life, that I showed up for her. But the customer was waiting, and I knew my boss would be checking the response times. My heart pounded as I stared at my phone, torn between sending a professional reply and rushing out the door to be the supportive sister I wanted to be. The weight of both expectations pressed down on me, and I stood frozen, caught between two worlds that suddenly felt impossible to balance.
